newsitem.title: FRANCE: Lyonnaise seeks 97 profit above 1.6 bln.
newsitem.headline: Lyonnaise seeks 97 profit above 1.6 bln.

text.p: Utilities group Lyonnaise des Eaux is aiming to make a profit this year of more than 1.6 billion francs, chairman Jerome Monod said on Thursday.
It earlier announced a net attributable profit for 1996 of 1.35 billion francs compared to 906 million the year before.

"Already we can expect a new increase in turnover and fix an objective of profits above 1.6 billion francs, a good rise," he said according to the text of a statement he was due to make at the presentation of its 1996 results.
Lyonnaise was to give a news conference on its results at 0900 GMT.
